solution_line_template: Traveling {travel_hours} hours due east at {speed_km_per_hour} kilometers per hour, the ship sailed {travel_hours}*{speed_km_per_hour}=<<{travel_hours}*{speed_km_per_hour}={distance_first_day}>>{distance_first_day} kilometers the first day.

If half the distance to the destination is {distance_first_day} kilometers, then {half_multiplier}*{distance_first_day}=<<{half_multiplier}*{distance_first_day}={total_destination_distance}>>{total_destination_distance} kilometers is the total distance from start to destination.

One-third of the distance from start to destination is {one_third_fraction} * {total_destination_distance} = <<{total_destination_distance}/{current_fraction_denominator}={current_distance_from_start}>>{current_distance_from_start} kilometers.

Thus, the wind storm blew the ship in a westward direction for {distance_first_day} - {current_distance_from_start} = <<{distance_first_day}-{current_distance_from_start}={distance_blown_westward}>>{distance_blown_westward} kilometers.
